descriptionSet.description: On this advertisement for Robert Barbour & Brother, a young Caucasian woman with exposed shoulders and soft looking skin is sniffing yellow roses. The image is titled "My Queen".

inscription.text: Robert Barbour & Brother Merchants & Shippers, Manchester. 1905
MacLure, MacDonald & Co., Ornamental Printers to the late Queen, Glasgow.
With Best Wishes for a Prosperous New Year ...From... Robert Barbour & Brother, Manchester. Shippers to All Markets of the World.

Specialities: Hand & Key White Shirtings, Prints, Woollens, Printed and Cotton Domettes, Velvets, Trouserings, And all kinds of Fancies. Grey and white Shirtings, Nainsooks, Dhooties, &c. Printed Sarries.

location.name: Delhi / The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art
Delhi / The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art

rights.text: Copyrighted. Copyright with the original artists and publishers.

text-en: Virtute Tutus [on emblem] Established 1815.

text-en: Specialities: Hand & Key White Shirtings, Prints, Woollens, Printed and Cotton Domettes, Velvets, Trouserings, And all kinds of Fancies. Grey and white Shirtings, Nainsooks, Dhooties, &c. Printed Sarries.

description-en: On this advertisement for Robert Barbour & Brother, a young Caucasian woman with exposed shoulders and soft looking skin is sniffing yellow roses. The image is titled "My Queen". (gs/ms/tb)
explanatory comments/crosstagging: /20080701_1754.jpg
explanatory comments/crosstagging: The Barbours were manufacturers and traders of linen. (ys)

explanatory comments/crosstagging: Robt. Barbour & Brother was the trading name of George Beatson Blair and James Thomas Blair, Manchester, merchants and shippers, cf. http://www.nationalarchives.gov.uk/A2A/records.aspx?cat=127-m294&cid=4-5-3-3#4-5-3-3 (ma)
explanatory comments/crosstagging: George Beatson Blair lived 1859-1940, James Thomas Blair lived 1863-1917, cf. http://www.ainslie.org.uk/genealogy/barbour/dat12.htm#16 (ma)

related hyperlinks: http://www.nationalarchives.gov.uk/A2A/records.aspx?cat=127-m294&cid=4-5-3-3#4-5-3-3, last accessed 2012-01-18, document of 1 Ja. 1909, held at Manchester Archives and Local Studies which identifies the Blair brothers George Beatson and James Thomas with "Robt. Barbour and Brother" (ma)
related hyperlinks: http://www.ainslie.org.uk/genealogy/barbour/dat12.htm#16, last accessed 2012-01-18, genealogy data record (ma)
